frame.name: Social_event
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs at which <fen>Attendee</fen>s are present to conduct a social function or joint activity. The <fen>Social_event</fen> is often a party or celebration, in which case it is possible to express someone who is being honored (the <fen>Honoree</fen>) or its function may be to celebrate an <fen>Occasion</fen> at which <fen>Attendee</fen>s are present. Often, a specific <fen>Attendee</fen>, the <fen>Host</fen>, provides a venue for people to gather.
<ex><fex name="Host">Sue</fex> <m>threw</m> a <fex name="Soc"><t>party</t></fex> <fex name="Occasion">for Bob's birthday</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Host">Who</fex> will <t>host</t> <fex name="Soc">the Olympic games</fex> <fex name="Time">in eight years</fex>?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Duration</fen> of time for which the <fen>Social_event</fen> is ongoing.</def-root>

FE.name: Social_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Social_event</fen> itself.
<ex>The department <fex name="Soc"><t>picnic</t></fex> was lots of fun.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Host
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Host</fen> is the person or organization that hosts the <fen>Social_event</fen>. In cases where an individual stands in for an organization, the host may be marked twice.
<ex><fex name="Host">Ron</fex> threw a <t>party</t>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Host">President Reagan</fex> hosted a <fex name="Host">state</fex> <t>banquet</t>.</ex> The FE <fen>Host</fen> is also used in ambiguous cases, such as: <ex><fex name="Host">church</fex> <fex name="Soc"><t>picnic</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person for whom the <fen>Social_event</fen> is held.
<ex>I threw a <t>party</t> <fex name="Beneficiary">for Josef</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Occasion
FE.definition: <def-root>The Occasion for which the <fen>Social_event</fen> is held.</def-root>

FE.name: Attendee
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Attendee</fen> is used for the people who come to the <fen>Social_event</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Att">The whole group</fex> attended the <t>party</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Refreshment
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Refreshment</fen> is used for the meal, food or drinks that are served at the <fen>Social_event</fen>.
<ex>I enjoy a tasteful <fex name="Ref">dinner</fex> <t>party</t>.</ex> <ex>I attended a <fex name="Ref">cocktail</fex> <t>party</t> and drank myself silly.</ex> <ex>First layer: I attended a <fex name="Soc"><t>banquet</t></fex> on Saturday. </ex> <ex>Second layer: I attended a <fex name="Ref"><t>banquet</t></fex> on Saturday. </ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Style
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Style</fen> of the <fen>Social_event</fen> and its level of formality, indicating appropriate dress for participants and/or the kind of activities in which they engage.
<ex>Lee hosted a <fex name="Style">formal</fex> <t>party</t>.</ex> <ex>Abby's <fex name="Sty">garden</fex> <t>party</t> was successful.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>COD: The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes how often the <fen>Social_event</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The reason the Social_event is being held.
<ex><fex name="Host">We</fex> threw a <t>banquet</t> <fex name="Purpose">to raise awareness to our cause</fex>.</ex></def-root>
